docs.text: ConfIDent-schema metamodel version: 1.7.0 version: 0.0.1 This is a schema for the ConfIDent project that describes the necessary metadata requirements of academic events and event series. Classes City ConfIDentRecord - This is a container to be able to bundle academic event and series data in one data file (e.g. YAML or JSON). Contributor Country Deadline EventType - An event type is a plan specification that specifies the sociocultural format or type of the academic event by providing details on the objectives, conditions and actions needed in its realization. Location Metric Organisation - An organization such as a company or university Organizer Person - A person (alive, dead, undead, or fictional). PlannedProcess AcademicEvent AcademicEventSeries ProcessName ProcessRelation Region Sponsor Venue Mixins Slots academic_fields - A relation obtaining between a obi:'planned process' and an academic field descriptor that is used to describe the scientific subject of the planned process according to some controlled vocabulary or thesaurus. address alternative_ids at_location ConfIDentRecord➞events - An attribute that specifies a list of academic events within this container. ConfIDentRecord➞series - An attribute that specifies a list of academic event series within this container. contact contributors ➞deadline_date ➞deadline_other deadlines denoted_by PlannedProcess➞denoted_by end_date - Similar to the start_date description but only for the end of an academic event or series. AcademicEvent➞end_date - A data property to provide the planned end date of an academic event in the xsd:dateTimeStamp format. ➞event_type_iri ➞event_type_other event_mode - The event mode describes whether the event is a physical, virtual or hybrid event. event_status AcademicEvent➞event_status event_type AcademicEvent➞event_type - The sociocultural event format which is specified by the organizers, e.g. conference. Possible values are defined in the EventType enum, which uses the named individuals defined in AEON. id in_series - The relation used to provide the series of which an AcademicEvent is a part. ➞city ➞country ➞lattitude ➞longitude ➞meeting_url ➞region ➞venue logo ➞int_value ➞other_metric ➞rate_value ➞str_value ➞truth_value metrics name Organisation➞name Person➞name ordinal - The ordnial number of an academic event within its series. organisations organizers AcademicEvent➞organizers outputs - The published works that are related to the academic event or event series, such as proceedings and video recordings of talks. persons ➞acronym ➞official_name related_to series_of - The relation used to provide the events belonging to an AcademicEventSeries. sponsors AcademicEvent➞sponsors start_date - The start date of an academic event or the start date of an academic event series. Wheres the latter will in reality most likely be the start date of the first event of this series, unless there is some other source from which it is possible to derive the date of the inception of the series. AcademicEvent➞start_date - A data property to provide the planned end date of an academic event in the xsd:dateTimeStamp format. summary topics type Contributor➞type Deadline➞type Metric➞type ProcessRelation➞type website Enums ContributorType DeadlineType EventMode EventStatus EventTypeValue - The following definitions attempt to provide descriptions to distinguish different academic event formats, even though the definitions are not always clearly distinguishable in their everyday use and are often used synonymously. According to the mapping to AEON , each permissible value on this list represents an AEON named individual MetricType RelationType Subsets Types Built in Bool Decimal ElementIdentifier NCName NodeIdentifier URI URIorCURIE XSDDate XSDDateTime XSDTime float int str Defined Boolean ( Bool ) - A binary (true or false) value Date ( XSDDate ) - a date (year, month and day) in an idealized calendar Datetime ( XSDDateTime ) - The combination of a date and time Decimal ( Decimal ) - A real number with arbitrary precision that conforms to the xsd:decimal specification Double ( float ) - A real number that conforms to the xsd:double specification Float ( float ) - A real number that conforms to the xsd:float specification Integer ( int ) - An integer Ncname ( NCName ) - Prefix part of CURIE Nodeidentifier ( NodeIdentifier ) - A URI, CURIE or BNODE that represents a node in a model. Objectidentifier ( ElementIdentifier ) - A URI or CURIE that represents an object in the model. String ( str ) - A character string Time ( XSDTime ) - A time object represents a (local) time of day, independent of any particular day Uri ( URI ) - a complete URI Uriorcurie ( URIorCURIE ) - a URI or a CURIE
docs.title: Index

docs.text: Class: EventType An event type is a plan specification that specifies the sociocultural format or type of the academic event by providing details on the objectives, conditions and actions needed in its realization. URI: confid:EventType Referenced by Class AcademicEvent AcademicEvent➞event_type 0..1 EventType Attributes Own ➞event_type_iri 1..1 Range: EventTypeValue ➞event_type_other 0..1 Range: String Other properties Mappings: aeon:AEON_0000004
docs.title: Class: EventType

docs.text: An event type is a plan specification that specifies the sociocultural format or type of the academic event by providing details on the objectives, conditions and actions needed in its realization. URI: confid:EventType
docs.title: Class: EventType

docs.text: Enum: EventTypeValue The following definitions attempt to provide descriptions to distinguish different academic event formats, even though the definitions are not always clearly distinguishable in their everyday use and are often used synonymously. According to the mapping to AEON , each permissible value on this list represents an AEON named individual URI: confid:EventTypeValue Other properties Permissible Values Text Description Meaning Other Information colloquium A colloquium is an academic meeting that usually lasts only a few hours and serves to discuss a specific topic. Colloquia are usually part of the academic exchange in everyday university life with only one speaker, but can also take place on special occasions (anniversaries, start or end of the lecture phase, etc.) and can have more than one speaker. aeon:AEON_0010000 conference A conference is an academic event that lasts up to several days and serves as a forum for presentations on a specific topic or subject area. In addition to subject-specific conferences, there are also interdisciplinary conferences which allow both a broader focus and more specific questions on a particular (academic) problem. Conferences often have a highly formalized structure of parallel, clearly defined sessions with several short presentations and plenary sessions with invited (keynote) speakers who are considered multipliers in their (research) field. Ideally, the selection of the speakers and their contributions is subject to a review process. aeon:AEON_0010001 congress A congress is a certain type of conference which is characterised by a larger number of participants (often several hundred) and is oftentimes organised jointly by large, established (e.g. specialised societies) and/or several institutions. Congresses have a broader thematic focus than simple conferences, take place in certain cycles, but can still target an exclusive group of participants (e.g. representatives of a single discipline). aeon:AEON_0010011 event session aeon:AEON_0010000 poster session aeon:AEON_0010005 event talk aeon:AEON_0010012 keynote speech aeon:AEON_0010007 event track aeon:AEON_0010008 forum aeon:AEON_0010002 hackathon aeon:AEON_0010003 seminar aeon:AEON_0010004 symposium aeon:AEON_0010006 tutorial aeon:AEON_0010009 workshop aeon:AEON_0010010 other event type This event type is only to be used, when the sociocultural format of the academic event you want to describe has an official label that is not on this list. If you use event type other then you must provide an event type description using the event_type_other property.
docs.title: Enum: EventTypeValue

docs.text: The following definitions attempt to provide descriptions to distinguish different academic event formats, even though the definitions are not always clearly distinguishable in their everyday use and are often used synonymously. According to the mapping to AEON , each permissible value on this list represents an AEON named individual URI: confid:EventTypeValue
docs.title: Enum: EventTypeValue

docs.text: Text Description Meaning Other Information colloquium A colloquium is an academic meeting that usually lasts only a few hours and serves to discuss a specific topic. Colloquia are usually part of the academic exchange in everyday university life with only one speaker, but can also take place on special occasions (anniversaries, start or end of the lecture phase, etc.) and can have more than one speaker. aeon:AEON_0010000 conference A conference is an academic event that lasts up to several days and serves as a forum for presentations on a specific topic or subject area. In addition to subject-specific conferences, there are also interdisciplinary conferences which allow both a broader focus and more specific questions on a particular (academic) problem. Conferences often have a highly formalized structure of parallel, clearly defined sessions with several short presentations and plenary sessions with invited (keynote) speakers who are considered multipliers in their (research) field. Ideally, the selection of the speakers and their contributions is subject to a review process. aeon:AEON_0010001 congress A congress is a certain type of conference which is characterised by a larger number of participants (often several hundred) and is oftentimes organised jointly by large, established (e.g. specialised societies) and/or several institutions. Congresses have a broader thematic focus than simple conferences, take place in certain cycles, but can still target an exclusive group of participants (e.g. representatives of a single discipline). aeon:AEON_0010011 event session aeon:AEON_0010000 poster session aeon:AEON_0010005 event talk aeon:AEON_0010012 keynote speech aeon:AEON_0010007 event track aeon:AEON_0010008 forum aeon:AEON_0010002 hackathon aeon:AEON_0010003 seminar aeon:AEON_0010004 symposium aeon:AEON_0010006 tutorial aeon:AEON_0010009 workshop aeon:AEON_0010010 other event type This event type is only to be used, when the sociocultural format of the academic event you want to describe has an official label that is not on this list. If you use event type other then you must provide an event type description using the event_type_other property.

docs.text: Class: PlannedProcess URI: confid:PlannedProcess Children AcademicEvent AcademicEventSeries Referenced by Class Attributes Own id 1..1 Range: Uriorcurie PlannedProcess➞denoted_by 1..1 Range: ProcessName alternative_ids 0..* Range: Uriorcurie start_date 0..1 Description: The start date of an academic event or the start date of an academic event series. Wheres the latter will in reality most likely be the start date of the first event of this series, unless there is some other source from which it is possible to derive the date of the inception of the series. Range: Datetime end_date 0..1 Description: Similar to the start_date description but only for the end of an academic event or series. Range: Datetime organizers 1..* Range: Organizer sponsors 0..* Range: String outputs 0..* Description: The published works that are related to the academic event or event series, such as proceedings and video recordings of talks. Range: String topics 0..* Range: String academic_fields 0..* Description: A relation obtaining between a obi:'planned process' and an academic field descriptor that is used to describe the scientific subject of the planned process according to some controlled vocabulary or thesaurus. Range: String metrics 0..* Range: Metric contact 0..1 Range: String website 0..1 Range: String logo 0..1 Range: String summary 0..1 Range: String related_to 0..* Range: ProcessRelation
